speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ross kissed me.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: It was unbelievable!

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, all right. We want to hear everything. Monica, get the wine and unplug the phone. Rachel, does this end well or do we need to get tissues?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Oh, it ended very well.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Oh.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Do not start without me. Do not start without me.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, all right, let's hear about the kiss. Was it like, was it like a soft brush against your lips? Or was it like a, you know, a "I gotta have you now" kind of thing?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Well, at first it was really intense, you know. And then, oh, god, and then we just sort of sunk into it.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, so, ok, was he holding you? Or was his hand like on your back?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: No, actually first they started on my waist. And then, they slid up, and then, they were in my hair.

speaker: ['Monica Geller', 'Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ohhhh.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: This is a nice resume. Nice, nice, nice. Muy impressivo.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: So, Mr. Rastatter, what exactly does this job entail? The ad wasn't too clear.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Mockolate.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: I'm sorry?

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Mockolate. It's a completely synthetic chocolate substitute.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ohh.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Go ahead. Try a piece. Yeah, we think that Mockolate is even better than chocolate.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: All right. Mmm-mmm.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Yeah?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: I love how it crumbles. Now see, your chocolate doesn't do that.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: No, ma'am. Well, anyhoo, we should be getting our F.D.A. approval any day now, hopefully, in time for Thanksgiving. See, the way we look at it, chocolate already dominates most of your major food-preparation holidays: Easter, Christmas, what have you.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Mmm-mmm.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: But, we're thinking, given the right marketing, we can make Thanksgiving the Mockolate holiday.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Wow.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Aren't you going to swallow that?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Just waiting for it to stop bubbling.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Yeah, isn't that great?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Mmm.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Well, anyhoo, um, we are looking for a couple of chefs who can create some Thanksgiving-themed recipes. You think you might be interested?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Abso... ...lutely. See, I love creating new recipes. I love Thanksgiving. And, well, now, I love Mockolate.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Really?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Especially the after taste, you know, I'll tell ya, that'll last ya till Christmas.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: How about Mockolate mousse?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: It's not, it's not very Thanksgiving-y.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok, how about pilgrim Mockolate mousse?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: What makes it pilgrim?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: We'll put buckles on it.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Hey.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Hey.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Hey.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Did uh, Ross call?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Why didn't he call? He's gonna stay with Julie, isn't he? He's gonna stay with her and she's going to be all, "Hi, I'm Julie, Ross picked me, and we're gonna to get married, have a lot of kids and dig up stuff together."

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: No offense, but that sounds nothing like her.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I don't know what to do. What am I gonna do? I mean, this, this is like a complete nightmare.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Oh, I know. This must be so hard. Oh, no. Two women love me. They're both gorgeous and sexy. My wallet's too small for my fifties, and my diamond shoes are too tight.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Hey, here's a thought, Ross.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Don't touch the computer. Don't ever touch the computer.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Ross, listen. I got two words for you. Threesome.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Ok, all right, look. Let's get logical about this, ok? We'll make a list. Rachel and Julie, pros and cons. Oh. We'll put their names in bold, with different fonts, and I can use different colors for each column.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Can't we just use a pen?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: No, Amish boy.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Ok, let's start with the cons, 'cause they're more fun. All right, Rachel first.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I don't know. I mean, all right, I guess you can say she's a little spoiled sometimes.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: You could say that.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: And I guess, you know, sometimes, she's a little ditzy, you know. And I've seen her be a little too into her looks. Oh, and Julie and I, we have a lot in common 'cause we're both paleontologists, but Rachel's just a waitress.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Waitress. Got it. You guys wanna play Doom? Or we could keep doing this. What else?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I don't know.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Oh, her ankles are a little chubby.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Ok, let's do Julie. What's wrong with her?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: She's not Rachel.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok, this is pumpkin pie with mockolate cookie crumb crust. This is mockolate cranberry cake, and these are mockolate chip cookies. Just like the Indians served.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Oh my god.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Oh my god good?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Oh my god, I can't believe you let me put this in my mouth.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Oh, oh sweet Lord! This is what evil must taste like!

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: My diary! My diary, that's brilliant. I should have told her it was my diary, she never would have made me read her my diary.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: You know, that's true. You'd be a great person to have around the day after an emergency.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: I... I cannot believe Ross even made this list. What a dinkus.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Hey, cut him some slack. It was Chandler's idea.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: What?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: What?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Oh good, I was hoping that would come up.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: This was your idea?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: What were you thinking?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: All right, let's get some perspective here, ok? These things, they happen for a reason.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Yeah. You!

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: All right, Pheebs, back me up here, ok? You believe in that karma crap, don't you?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Yeah, by the way, good luck in your next life as a dung beetle.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Rach! Whoops! Rach, hey, open up, please!

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: When somebody does not buzz you in, Ross, that means go away. That doesn't mean please climb up the fire escape.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I just wanna read something. It's your pro list.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Not interested.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Ok, ok, number one: The way you cry at game shows. Number two: how much you love your friends. Number three: the way you play with your hair when you're nervous. Number four: how brave you are for starting your life over. Number five: how great you are with Ben.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Number six: the way you smell.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Hey, Ross! What are you doin'?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Hey, Joey. You wanna open the window?

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Oh, yeah, I do.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: What are you doing out there?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I am, uh, I am...

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Oh, you must be freezing. You know what you need? How about a nice steaming cup of hot Mockolate?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Rach, come on, open up. Rach, come on, come on, Rach. You got to give me another chance.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: No.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: No?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: That's what I said.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Look, maybe we should go?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: No, you guys, you really don't have to go, we're done talking.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Rach, come on, look, I know how you must feel.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: No, you don't, Ross. Imagine the worst things you think about yourself. Now, how would you feel if the one person that you trusted the most in the world not only thinks them too, but actually uses them as reasons not to be with you.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: No, but, but I wanna be with you in spite of all those things.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Oh, well, that's, that's mighty big of you, Ross. I said don't go!

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: You know what? You know what? If, things were the other way around, there's nothing you could put on a list that would ever make me not want to be with you.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Well, then, I guess that's the difference between us. See, I'd never make a list.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: I never know how long you're supposed to wait in this type of a situation before you can talk again, you know? Maybe a little longer.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Now, in some of these recipes, the quantities may seem just a little unusual, uh, like these coconut mockolate holiday nut bars. I've indicated four cups of coconut, and four cups of crushed nut, and only, uh, one tablespoon of mockolate.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Doesn't matter.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: What?

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Our FDA approval didn't come through. Something about laboratory rats.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Oh, gosh, I'm sorry.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Yeah, well, anyhoo, here is your check. Thank you for all the trouble you went through. Um, listen, you didn't eat a lot of it while you were cooking, did you?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Well, uh, I ate some.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Oh, some, that's fine. Some is fine. Some is not a lot. So, it doesn't burn when you pee, does it?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Hello?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Hi.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Is that him again? Tell him I'd come to the phone, but my ankles are weighin' me down.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Listen, I... I don't think this is the best time.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Look, can, can you do something for me?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Sure, what? Ok, ok. Music?

speaker: ['Radio']
transcript: The next one's dedicated to Rachel from Ross. Rachel, he wants you to know he's deeply sorry for what he did and he hopes you can find it in your heart to forgive him.

speaker: ['Radio']
transcript: Uh, we've just gotten a call from Rachel, and she told us what Ross did. It's pretty appalling, and Ross, if you're listening, I don't wanna play your song anymore. Why don't we devote our time to a couple that stands a chance? Avery, Michelle's sorry she hit you with her car and she hopes you two will work it out.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Hi, thanks for coming in again.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Oh, not at all. I have no morals and I need the cash.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: It's like I'm lookin' in a mirror. Anyway, they're called "fishtachios". They taste exactly like pistachios, but they're made primarily of reconstituted fish bits. Here, try one. You're not allergic to anything, are you?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Cat hair.

speaker: ['Mr. Ratstatter']
transcript: Oh, sorry.
